message: The DATA_COMP field for indicator 3-8-2, translated into all languages

data.en:
# Methodology

## Computation method

Population weighted average number of people with large household expenditure on health as a share of total household expenditure or income

\\[ { { \underset{i} \Sigma m_i \omega_i 1 } ( { { \text{health expenditure of the household } i } \over { \text{total expenditure of the household } i } } >  \gamma ) } \over { \underset{i} \Sigma m_i \omega_i}\\]

where *ğ‘–* denotes a household, *1()* is the indicator function that takes on the value 1 if the bracketed expression is true, and 0 otherwise, m<sub>ğ‘–</sub> corresponds to the number of household members of *ğ‘–*, Ï‰<sub>ğ‘–</sub> corresponds to the sampling weight of household *ğ‘–*, Ï„ is a threshold identifying large household expenditure on health as a share of total household consumption or income (i.e. 10% and 25%).

Household health expenditure and household expenditure or income are defined as explained in the â€œconceptâ€ section. For more information about the methodology please refer to Wagstaff et al (2018) and chapter 2 in the WHO and World Bank 2017 report on tracking universal health coverage.
